intro: Distephanus subluteus, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Distephanus subluteus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
